name: TownePlace Suites San Antonio Northwest

reviews.text: We picked this hotel because it was close to Six Flags and Seaworld. This hotel appears nice at first glance but it's really not. We got the room directly across from the elevators. I heard the dings from the elevator all night long. I didn't complain or change rooms because I used points and we figured they give the bad rooms to the non-paying customers.
reviews.title: No Towels!

reviews.text: Upon entering the room I immediately noticed a clump of hair on the foyer tile so it was obvious they didn't bother vacuuming. But we didn't care too much because after a long day at Six Flags we just wanted a shower. It was 5 pm and there were no towels in the bathroom. Not a one. I called the front desk and they said they would send some up. At 7 pm and still no towels. I called again and they said they were still in the dryer. At 7:30 pm they brought me 2 towels. I told them again that I have zero towels - not even a hand towel and 2 towels won't cut it for 4 people. By 8 pm I had a full set finally.
reviews.title: Will never book anywhere else!

reviews.text: Next day we went to Seaworld and came back at 6 pm to - surprise - no towels. I called the front desk again and they said they would send some up. Called again at 8 pm and they again said they were still in the dryer but they would add me to the list of rooms that needed towels. I have never stayed at a hotel where they didn't have enough towels. We finally got our towels at 8:30 pm - and of course they were ripped and stained. But they were hot so I knew they just came out of the dryer.
reviews.title: Nice clean suite and good breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will never stay there again.
reviews.title: Close to Magestic!

reviews.text: This hotel is perfect! Not a single bad thing to say about it. Looking forward to Visiting soon.
reviews.title: First and last stay

reviews.text: Nice out door pool and grill area. Clean room. Second time at this place, will go back.
reviews.title: Can't go wrong

reviews.text: I stayed here for 5 nights and the entire experience was better than expected. When I checked in there was a glich with AAA's payment to the hotel but the desk staff was extremely helpful and pleasant throughout the entire time it took to get that straightened out. My room was clean and updated. The carpet had a few stains but was in good shape. The happy hour "snacks" was enough for a meal and included wine. Breakfast had more than enough for everyone to choose from. My room was on the front side of the hotel so there was a bit of noise from the truck route on the road next to the hotel but that was primarily during the day. Nights were extremely quiet. The air conditioning/heating unit located below the window, blew air across the top of the bed but I could deflect that with extra pillows so it didn't blow right on me. I would definately stay here again when travelng to San Antonio.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: I stayed here for 5 nights, while on a business trip. The room was a good size, very comfortable bed and fully equipped kitchen. The kitchen had a full size fridge, dishwasher, toaster, coffee maker, pots and pans, cutlery, plates, mugs! Hot breakfast was served in the lobby daily, however it always closed up early. If you don't get there early enough, you were left with coffee and a basket of apples. There was a social hour every night (from 5.30) that I did not try, as we had dinner engagements while in town. The hotel also has a pool.
reviews.title: Overall Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was surprised that the hotel allowed pets (new to me!) so you may want to note in case of allergies or young kids. I only encountered dogs when the owners were taking them out for their walks- never any pets in the lobby areas. I felt that the cleanliness was not quite up to par. The daily maid service appeared to miss some obvious spots. The hotel got busier later in the week, and I could hear the upstairs guest in the morning.
reviews.title: What a Wonderful Surprise

reviews.text: The WiFi worked well. Plenty of parking. Overall, a decent stay.
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Great Location!

reviews.text: Great hotel for the money, except for one biggish problem and an annoying little one.
reviews.title: Would be four stars, but...

reviews.text: First, the good news: the Towneplace Suites is reasonably priced and attractive, with spacious, well-appointed suites - a very positive first impression. However, the design of the rooms comes with one very problematic flaw: the air conditioner unit is located VERY near the beds and blows cold air directly across them. This is based on my two stays at this hotel in two different rooms. The AC is about one or two feet from the bed and blows frigid air across the side. If you adjust the thermostat warmer, then you get no AC at all until it finally kicks in and blows refrigerated air directly on you again.
reviews.title: Wow!!

reviews.text: Honestly, this is crazy. At other hotels, the AC typically is some distance (two meters or so) from the bed and usually blows toward the foot of the bed (like at the Courtyard where I'm writing this review from). I was fairly miserable all night, either too warm or way too cold. (My only "solution" was to throw a blanket over 70% of the AC unit, thus preventing most of the cold air from freezing me while still keeping the room comfortable during a San Antonio heat wave.)
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for the price

reviews.text: The other problem is far less serious, but makes me wonder about quality control from manufacturers and at hotel chains. The bathroom sink has no way to let the (dirty/soapy) water drain unless you stick your hand in and flip the drain plug up, which rotates.
reviews.title: Clean and nice.

reviews.text: Don't know what I mean? Think about the bathroom sink in your home, or at your hotel as you read this. Does it have a mechanical device such as a plunger that you press down to drain the water out? Of course it does. But at the Towneplace Suites, someone decided that it was a cool design idea to force you to stick your hand in the sink after you've shaved (or whatever), then flip the drain plug with your thumb to force it open (good luck!) and drain the water out. I'm sure some 24 year-old fresh out of design school got an award for this idiotic idea. But I'd never put these sinks in a hotel that I managed.
reviews.title: Great place for business or leisure!

reviews.text: I was looking at options and this hotel was reasonably priced. The rooms are not large but there is a kitchennette suite and a small seating area it is a Marriott hotel. This is not a shabby room by any means. They offer a nice breakfast with waffles. Unfortunately I had stayed at a Towne Place where I thought they served some fruit other than apples. That is my only 1 of 2 gripes. Safe neighborhood. Quiet enought to sleep. Nice to have a laundry bucket in the closet as the other Towneplace didn't have that. Washing and drying was very expensive at 2 dollars/wash and 2 dollars/dry compared to a dollar elsewhere for each. Good service although my room service was not the best. Often the maids just didn't clear out the coffeepot although that is the one utility I always used. Adequate parking and reasonable location near I 10. Plenty of restaurants and shopping malls nearby. i would stay again and I would recommend others to stay here. Had some problems getting on the internet although it is free on the hotel server.
reviews.title: for north san antonio this is a good deal

reviews.text: As a single women traveling and staying here for business for two weeks it is alright. I usually eat healthy so I didn't find too much at the free breakfast and the nightly snacks are usually don't look too good so I haven't tried them. But the staff is good and did take my grocery list to the store and stock up so I can eat some nibbles in the room. The shuttle is alright but at busy times would be great if they could have two people driving. I've had to wait quite a bit the two times I used it outside the normal trip to work in the morning.
reviews.title: It's Okay...

reviews.text: I have never stayed at any hotel where the staff was as friendly as at the TownePlace Suites! They are always ready to assist, and I keep going back! The rooms are very clean and neat, and I have absolutely no concerns when staying there. As I am usually alone, I feel very safe and like I am at home. I have had numerous surgeries in San Antonio, and it is wonderful to have a comforting place to go afterwards.
reviews.title: Just Like Home!!

reviews.text: Really a great place with great people! (And I'd like to transport the bed to my home --- best sleep I ever had!)
reviews.title: Good, basic hotel - would stay here again

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night as a last-minute option to use my Marriott Rewards points. We had adjoining rooms, and one of the rooms was small as other reviews have stated. We had to move the table in the small room in order to have the adjoining doors open. The other room was an accessible room so it was much larger (but no coffee table in the room). Both rooms had a big fridge, dishwasher, sink, microwave, and stovetop. The kitchen was also fully stocked with silverware and plates. The breakfast was great -- good hot options (eggs, sausage, biscuits & gravy, make-your-own waffles). The staff was friendly -- we were able to check in early so that was a big plus. The hotel was right off I-10 so it was easy to get to, and there are lots of restaurants and other things to do nearby. I would've given this hotel 4 stars but I couldn't because there were stains on the carpet and on the couch in my room. However, I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Room was too small for 2 adults and one child.

aka: Towneplace Suites San Antonio Northwest Hotel
